intro: Cleome diversifolia, commonly known as spider flower, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is characterized by its showy, daisy-like flowers that range in color from white to pink and purple. The plant has alternate, ovate to lance-shaped leaves that are often hairy. It thrives in full sun to partial shade and prefers well-drained soil. Cleome diversifolia is often grown as an ornamental plant for its attractive blooms and easy care requirements.
